questions.question: What is a monolithic architecture?
options: A software architecture model where all components are tightly coupled
A system that distributes components across multiple nodes
A design for real-time communication
A decentralized architecture for microservices
questions.answer: A software architecture model where all components are tightly coupled

questions.question: What is a client-server architecture?
options: An architecture where each client has its own dedicated server
A distributed system model with centralized servers providing resources to multiple clients
A peer-to-peer network design
A system designed for publish-subscribe messaging
questions.answer: A distributed system model with centralized servers providing resources to multiple clients

questions.question: What is the publish-subscribe architecture?
options: An architecture for direct communication between publishers and subscribers
A messaging model where publishers send data to topics and subscribers receive data from topics
A design for client-server communication
A protocol for real-time data synchronization
questions.answer: A messaging model where publishers send data to topics and subscribers receive data from topics

questions.question: What is the key feature of microservices architecture?
options: All components are implemented as a single, tightly coupled unit
Services are small, independent, and loosely coupled
It relies on centralized storage for data management
It cannot scale across multiple servers
questions.answer: Services are small, independent, and loosely coupled

questions.question: What is XaaS in distributed systems?
options: A term that refers to any service delivered over the internet
A storage solution for large datasets
A model for peer-to-peer communication
A design principle for monolithic applications
questions.answer: A term that refers to any service delivered over the internet

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)?
options: Google Workspace
Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines
Salesforce
Heroku

questions.question: What does the Raft consensus algorithm solve?
options: Load balancing across servers
Leader election and state replication in distributed systems
Optimizing client-server communication
Reducing storage redundancy in distributed systems
questions.answer: Leader election and state replication in distributed systems

questions.question: What is a self-signed certificate?
options: A certificate issued by a trusted Certificate Authority
A certificate signed by the owner, not a Certificate Authority
A certificate used for encrypting real-time video streams
A certificate required for all HTTPS traffic
questions.answer: A certificate signed by the owner, not a Certificate Authority

questions.question: What is the purpose of a Certificate Signing Request (CSR)?
options: To generate a private key for encryption
To request a digital certificate from a Certificate Authority
To revoke an existing certificate
To establish a secure peer-to-peer connection
questions.answer: To request a digital certificate from a Certificate Authority

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the 12-factor app methodology?
options: To design monolithic applications
To create scalable and maintainable cloud-native applications
To optimize hardware usage
To provide security for distributed systems
questions.answer: To create scalable and maintainable cloud-native applications

questions.question: What does the 'Factor 1: Codebase' in the 12-factor app methodology mean?
options: The application must be split into multiple repositories
The application should have a single codebase tracked in version control
Each service should maintain its own codebase
The codebase must not be shared across environments
questions.answer: The application should have a single codebase tracked in version control
